<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
HARDWARE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/13/apple-releases-groundbreaking-5genabled-iphone-12-line?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
What Do Eggs, Donuts, and iPhones Have in Common?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="iPhone 12 " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yNzcxL2lwaG9uZV8xMi5wbmciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Apple</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As of yesterday, they all come in 12s. Apple CEO Tim Cook <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2020/10/13/21508028/apple-iphone-12-pro-max-homepod-mini-event-recap-biggest-announcements?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">unveiled</a> the iPhone 12 line at the company’s “Hi, Speed” event (hey Timmy, next time tap us for your wordplay). </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Included in the lineup is the iPhone 12, iPhone 12 Mini, iPhone 12 Pro, and iPhone 12 Pro Max. The major updates? Glad you asked…</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0"><strong style="color:#000">No. 1: The fifth generation is here</strong></h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The entire line is 5G-enabled, a major tech step forward. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Calm down, Galaxy stans, we can hear your scoffs from here. Samsung and Google have had 5G for a bit now, but like it or not, Apple’s offerings “validate the technology,” Moor Insights & Strategy analyst Mark Vena <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/apple-event-iphone-12-expected-with-5g-capabilities-11602581403?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">told the WSJ</a>. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>These phones don’t include many additional whizbang features, so Cook made sure to explain how 5G would justify starting prices between $699 and $1099: faster download and upload speeds, plus added benefits for business users. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>But even those perks depend on a fully built-out 5G network, which is still in the works. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>iPhones have always been pricey, and <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2020/10/13/apple-event-iphone-12-live-updates/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">it’s unclear</a> how the current recession will affect consumers’ willingness to upgrade their phones. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0"><strong style="color:#000">No. 2: Small is the new black...but so is big </strong></h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The line includes the iPhone’s first-ever Mini, which resembles the teensy iPhone SE, but with a larger screen. The 12 Pro Max, on the other hand, <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/10/13/apple-iphone-event-live-updates.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">features</a> the largest iPhone screen ever. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">All versions of the iPhone 12 have flat sides, which will remind you of your high school Vine-ing days—it was last seen on iPhones 4 and 5. The benefit of flat sides? Users like a phone that can stand on its own. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0"><strong style="color:#000">No. 3: Getting a new iPhone will feel less RoboCop-y</strong></h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">They’ll no longer come with corded headphones and charging bricks—unclear if that’s a sustainability thing (as Apple says), or a deciding-to-spend-less-money thing. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>on average, analysts project iPhone revenue will reach $160 billion this fiscal year, per a FactSet survey. That’s not chump change, but it’s short of Apple’s 2018 record—and underlies Apple’s strategy of banking more on its software services and wearables businesses. </p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
EARNINGS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/13/q3-earnings-improvement-previous-quarter?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Q3 Earnings: The Great Awakening
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Ace ventura reawakening" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=376 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/5UKCYVAaYUPcFreMPI/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Ace ventura reawakening" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/5UKCYVAaYUPcFreMPI/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">JPMorgan <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-jpmorgan-results/jpmorgan-less-worried-on-loans-as-trading-booms-idUSKBN26Y1FI?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">opened</a> Q3 earnings season with a fireworks display, barely setting aside any money for loan losses and revealing muscular profits.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Then again, this quarter’s earnings is like following Professor Snape at comedy open mic night—you're probably going to look good either way.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Q2 earnings (the quarter from April through June) were bleak, considering the heavy restrictions on businesses. S&P 500 companies reported a <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/investors-are-betting-corporate-earnings-have-turned-a-corner-11602408600?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">32% drop</a> in earnings year-over-year. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This latest quarter? With states easing restrictions, corporate financials shouldn't be <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/10/12/third-quarter-earnings-season-kicks-off-this-week-and-results-should-be-much-better-than-expected.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">as bad</a>. S&P earnings are only expected to drop 21%, which, yes, is still a lot, but it's an improvement from Q2 and earlier forecasts.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Future projections (known as “guidance”) tell a different story. Because the pandemic threw companies' five-year plans into the shredder, more than a quarter of S&P firms still aren't offering earnings guidance for 2020 or 2021...which means hitting targets or "beating" analyst estimates won't be all that informative.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SOCIAL MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/13/facebook-cracks-antivax-adsbut-ads?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Facebook Opens Another Can of Ban
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Mark Zuckerbeg " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83NjAvbWFya196dWNrZXJiZWcuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em><div>"<a href="https://www.flickr.com/photos/quintanomedia/46857789715/" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Mark Zuckerberg F8 2019 Keynote</a>" (<a href="https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/2.0/" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">CC BY 2.0</a>) by <a href="https://www.flickr.com/people/quintanomedia/" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Anthony Quintano</a>
</div></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">About a month ago, Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg got a taste of blocking content from his social media platforms, and he’s taken to it like the newly single and hiking. Yesterday, Facebook <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/10/13/facebook-bans-anti-vax-ads.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">banned</a> ads that discourage vaccination.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But...only those specific ads. Facebook will <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2020/10/13/21514535/facebook-anti-vaxx-ad-ban-moderation-covid-19-vaccine?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">still allow</a> organic (user-generated) antivax content and ads that advocate against vaccine-related government policies, including those related to a Covid-19 vaccine. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The current level of public trust in vaccination would be worryingly low even if it weren’t our best hope to recover from a historic crisis. From May to September, the share of Americans who said they’d get a vaccine if one became available dropped from about 70% to 50%. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>After initially advocating for free speech above all else, Zuckerberg has <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/10/13/technology/facebook-bans-anti-vaccination-ads.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">choked off</a> various kinds of harmful content in the past few weeks, starting with vaccine-related hoaxes identified by global health authorities. Then last week, groups, pages, and Instagram accounts identified with the conspiracy theory QAnon <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/10/06/technology/facebook-qanon-crackdown.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">got purged</a>, followed by Holocaust denialism on Monday.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENERGY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/13/solar-overtake-coal-2025-iea-report-says?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Big Sun Takes on Big Oil
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Solar tan" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yNzczL3NvbGFyX3Rhbi5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Get ready to witness a new kind of solar eclipse. In 2025, solar power is expected to <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/iea-energy-renewables-idUSL8N2H34DW?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">overtake coal</a> as the largest means of energy production, according to the International Energy Agency's (IEA) annual World Energy Outlook report. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">How we got here: </strong>Solar projects are getting cheaper to manufacture and install, and more governments are setting ambitious targets to cut emissions and reduce their fossil fuel dependence. In most countries, solar is already cheaper than coal and gas. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Over the next decade, the IEA </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/coronavirus-pandemic-speeds-shift-to-cleaner-energy-11602561601?mod=business_lead_pos6&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">predicts</a></span><span> renewables will account for 80% of new power generation. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>But to integrate more renewable sources, investments in the energy grid need to rise to at least $460 billion in 2030. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The IEA's report lays out painful numbers for fossil fuel incumbents. Investors are growing more skeptical of oil and gas projects, and 2020 investments have fallen by a third compared to last year. Coal's share of the global energy supply is expected to dip below 20% in 2040 for the first time since the industrial revolution.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>"I see solar becoming the new king of the world's electricity markets," IEA Executive Director Fatih Birol told reporters.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
RETAIL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/13/justin-bieber-crocs-collaboration-sells?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Guess That Stock
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<img alt="A stock chart displaying a crash in mid-March and steady rise upward since" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yNzcyL2Nyb2NzLnBuZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Google Finance</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Participation trophy if you said Lululemon, but the company behind this remarkable share price rebound is Crocs. Yes, that Crocs. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, Justin Bieber dropped a <a href="https://www.cnn.com/style/article/justin-bieber-crocs-intl-scli/index.html#:~:text=Crocs%20teamed%20up%20with%20the,be%20added%20to%20the%20footwear.&text=The%20Crocs%20X%20Justin%20Bieber,be%20released%20Tuesday%2C%20at%20%2459.99.?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">limited-edition Crocs collab</a> that sold out online within hours. The Biebs isn't the only influencer excited about Swiss cheese clogs on his feet:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>A few weeks ago, supplies of rapper Bad Bunny's glow-in-the-dark Crocs emptied in minutes. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>In July, </span><span><a href="https://www.today.com/food/crocs-just-released-kfc-clogs-they-actually-smell-chicken-t187865?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">KFC-branded Crocs</a></span><span> (complete with a scented drumstick charm) sold out faster than a Popeyes chicken sandwich. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What's going on?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">From <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/retail/stories/2020/09/21/hill-house-home-managed-overwhelming-demand-nap-dress-pandemic?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Victorian nightgowns</a> to living with your parents, the pandemic and WFH have brought a few trends back into the mainstream. But Crocs's success can also be attributed to fashion's slow-burning embrace of <a href="https://investorplace.com/2020/10/worlds-biggest-fashion-trend-buy-crox-stock/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">function over form</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">With its durability, low price point, personalization, and celebrity collabs, Crocs has proven it has staying power following its 2007 peak. Some of the biggest names in fashion, like Gucci and Yeezy, have even copied its signature style. </p>

style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nHARDWARE\n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nWhat Do Eggs, Donuts, and iPhones Have in Common?\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"iPhone 12 \" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yNzcxL2lwaG9uZV8xMi5wbmciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eApple\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAs of yesterday, they all come in 12s. Apple CEO Tim Cook \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2020/10/13/21508028/apple-iphone-12-pro-max-homepod-mini-event-recap-biggest-announcements?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eunveiled\u003c/a\u003e the iPhone 12 line at the company’s “Hi, Speed” event (hey Timmy, next time tap us for your wordplay). \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIncluded in the lineup is the iPhone 12, iPhone 12 Mini, iPhone 12 Pro, and iPhone 12 Pro Max. The major updates? Glad you asked…\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eNo. 1: The fifth generation is here\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe entire line is 5G-enabled, a major tech step forward. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCalm down, Galaxy stans, we can hear your scoffs from here. Samsung and Google have had 5G for a bit now, but like it or not, Apple’s offerings “validate the technology,” Moor Insights \u0026 Strategy analyst Mark Vena \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/apple-event-iphone-12-expected-with-5g-capabilities-11602581403?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etold the WSJ\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThese phones don’t include many additional whizbang features, so Cook made sure to explain how 5G would justify starting prices between $699 and $1099: faster download and upload speeds, plus added benefits for business users. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBut even those perks depend on a fully built-out 5G network, which is still in the works. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eiPhones have always been pricey, and \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2020/10/13/apple-event-iphone-12-live-updates/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eit’s unclear\u003c/a\u003e how the current recession will affect consumers’ willingness to upgrade their phones. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eNo. 2: Small is the new black...but so is big \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe line includes the iPhone’s first-ever Mini, which resembles the teensy iPhone SE, but with a larger screen. The 12 Pro Max, on the other hand, \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/10/13/apple-iphone-event-live-updates.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efeatures\u003c/a\u003e the largest iPhone screen ever. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAll versions of the iPhone 12 have flat sides, which will remind you of your high school Vine-ing days—it was last seen on iPhones 4 and 5. The benefit of flat sides? Users like a phone that can stand on its own. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eNo. 3: Getting a new iPhone will feel less RoboCop-y\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThey’ll no longer come with corded headphones and charging bricks—unclear if that’s a sustainability thing (as Apple says), or a deciding-to-spend-less-money thing. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eon average, analysts project iPhone revenue will reach $160 billion this fiscal year, per a FactSet survey. That’s not chump change, but it’s short of Apple’s 2018 record—and underlies Apple’s strategy of banking more on its software services and wearables businesses. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eopened\u003c/a\u003e Q3 earnings season with a fireworks display, barely setting aside any money for loan losses and revealing muscular profits.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThen again, this quarter’s earnings is like following Professor Snape at comedy open mic night—you're probably going to look good either way.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eQ2 earnings (the quarter from April through June) were bleak, considering the heavy restrictions on businesses. S\u0026P 500 companies reported a \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/investors-are-betting-corporate-earnings-have-turned-a-corner-11602408600?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e32% drop\u003c/a\u003e in earnings year-over-year. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThis latest quarter? With states easing restrictions, corporate financials shouldn't be \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/10/12/third-quarter-earnings-season-kicks-off-this-week-and-results-should-be-much-better-than-expected.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eas bad\u003c/a\u003e. S\u0026P earnings are only expected to drop 21%, which, yes, is still a lot, but it's an improvement from Q2 and earlier forecasts.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFuture projections (known as “guidance”) tell a different story. Because the pandemic threw companies' five-year plans into the shredder, more than a quarter of S\u0026P firms still aren't offering earnings guidance for 2020 or 2021...which means hitting targets or \"beating\" analyst estimates won't be all that informative.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAbout a month ago, Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg got a taste of blocking content from his social media platforms, and he’s taken to it like the newly single and hiking. Yesterday, Facebook \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/10/13/facebook-bans-anti-vax-ads.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebanned\u003c/a\u003e ads that discourage vaccination.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut...only those specific ads. Facebook will \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2020/10/13/21514535/facebook-anti-vaxx-ad-ban-moderation-covid-19-vaccine?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estill allow\u003c/a\u003e organic (user-generated) antivax content and ads that advocate against vaccine-related government policies, including those related to a Covid-19 vaccine. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe current level of public trust in vaccination would be worryingly low even if it weren’t our best hope to recover from a historic crisis. From May to September, the share of Americans who said they’d get a vaccine if one became available dropped from about 70% to 50%. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eAfter initially advocating for free speech above all else, Zuckerberg has \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/10/13/technology/facebook-bans-anti-vaccination-ads.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003echoked off\u003c/a\u003e various kinds of harmful content in the past few weeks, starting with vaccine-related hoaxes identified by global health authorities. Then last week, groups, pages, and Instagram accounts identified with the conspiracy theory QAnon \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/10/06/technology/facebook-qanon-crackdown.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003egot purged\u003c/a\u003e, followed by Holocaust denialism on Monday.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eGet ready to witness a new kind of solar eclipse. In 2025, solar power is expected to \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/iea-energy-renewables-idUSL8N2H34DW?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eovertake coal\u003c/a\u003e as the largest means of energy production, according to the International Energy Agency's (IEA) annual World Energy Outlook report. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHow we got here: \u003c/strong\u003eSolar projects are getting cheaper to manufacture and install, and more governments are setting ambitious targets to cut emissions and reduce their fossil fuel dependence. In most countries, solar is already cheaper than coal and gas. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eOver the next decade, the IEA \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/coronavirus-pandemic-speeds-shift-to-cleaner-energy-11602561601?mod=business_lead_pos6\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epredicts\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e renewables will account for 80% of new power generation. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBut to integrate more renewable sources, investments in the energy grid need to rise to at least $460 billion in 2030. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe IEA's report lays out painful numbers for fossil fuel incumbents. Investors are growing more skeptical of oil and gas projects, and 2020 investments have fallen by a third compared to last year. Coal's share of the global energy supply is expected to dip below 20% in 2040 for the first time since the industrial revolution.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003e\"I see solar becoming the new king of the world's electricity markets,\" IEA Executive Director Fatih Birol told reporters.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eParticipation trophy if you said Lululemon, but the company behind this remarkable share price rebound is Crocs. Yes, that Crocs. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, Justin Bieber dropped a \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/style/article/justin-bieber-crocs-intl-scli/index.html#:~:text=Crocs%20teamed%20up%20with%20the,be%20added%20to%20the%20footwear.\u0026text=The%20Crocs%20X%20Justin%20Bieber,be%20released%20Tuesday%2C%20at%20%2459.99.?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elimited-edition Crocs collab\u003c/a\u003e that sold out online within hours. The Biebs isn't the only influencer excited about Swiss cheese clogs on his feet:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eA few weeks ago, supplies of rapper Bad Bunny's glow-in-the-dark Crocs emptied in minutes. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eIn July, \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.today.com/food/crocs-just-released-kfc-clogs-they-actually-smell-chicken-t187865?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eKFC-branded Crocs\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e (complete with a scented drumstick charm) sold out faster than a Popeyes chicken sandwich. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat's going on?\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFrom \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/retail/stories/2020/09/21/hill-house-home-managed-overwhelming-demand-nap-dress-pandemic?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eVictorian nightgowns\u003c/a\u003e to living with your parents, the pandemic and WFH have brought a few trends back into the mainstream. But Crocs's success can also be attributed to fashion's slow-burning embrace of \u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/2020/10/worlds-biggest-fashion-trend-buy-crox-stock/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efunction over form\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWith its durability, low price point, personalization, and celebrity collabs, Crocs has proven it has staying power following its 2007 peak. Some of the biggest names in fashion, like Gucci and Yeezy, have even copied its signature style. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\"
